cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (125 km) south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate northwest, cross western Cuba on Tuesday, enter the southeast Gulf of Mexico Wednesday, then continue northwest-to-north toward the central/northern Gulf Coast late Thursday and Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (most likely south-central or southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Artemisa, and the Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana Province
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands (including Little Cayman and Cayman Brac)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to the western Florida Panhandle lies inside the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Thu night and Fri; low (10%) chance of 50-kt winds, minimal chance of hurricane-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft or higher possible along southeast Louisiana coast, including the Mississippi River delta, if current forecast track holds
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday, with locally higher totals and flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large waves, hazardous seas on approaches to the Lower Mississippi; potential temporary closure of Mississippi River traffic and pilotage operations
